item.title: Georges Brassens
item.description: Georges Charles Brassens was a French singer-songwriter and poet.

item.title: Francis Cabrel
item.description: Francis Cabrel is a French singer-songwriter-composer and guitarist. He has released a number of albums falling mostly within the realm of folk, with occasional forays into blues or country. Several of his songs, such as 'L'Encre de Tes Yeux,' 'Petite Marie,' 'Je l'Aime à Mourir', and 'La Corrida,' have become enduring favorites in French music. Cabrel is considered one the most influential French musical artists of all time.

item.title: Jacques Brel
item.description: Jacques Romain Georges Brel was a Belgian singer, songwriter, actor and director who composed and performed literate, thoughtful, and theatrical songs that generated a large, devoted following—initially in Belgium and France, later throughout the world. He is considered a master of the modern chanson. Although he recorded most of his songs in French and occasionally in Dutch, he became an influence on English-speaking songwriters and performers, such as Scott Walker, David Bowie, Alex Harvey, Marc Almond and Rod McKuen. English translations of his songs were recorded by many performers, including: Bowie; Walker, Ray Charles; Judy Collins; John Denver; The Kingston Trio; Nina Simone; Frank Sinatra and Andy Williams.

item.title: Yuri Loza
item.description: Yuri Eduardovich Loza is a Russian singer, poet, and composer.

item.title: Matthieu Chedid
item.description: Matthieu Chedid, better known by his stage name -M-, is a French rock singer-songwriter and guitar player. He holds the gold place in number of Victoires de la Musique awards, with 13 awards.

item.title: Leonid Agutin
item.description: Leonid Nikolayevich Agutin is a Russian pop musician and songwriter, Meritorious Artist of Russia (2008). He has been active since the 1990s. He has released ten albums and three compilation albums.

item.title: Joe Dassin
item.description: Joseph Ira Dassin was an American-born French singer-songwriter.

item.title: Alexander Rosenbaum
item.description: Alexander Yakovlevich Rosenbaum PAR is a Russian bard from Saint Petersburg. He is best known as an interpreter of the blatnaya pesnya genre. Modern singers in this genre, such as Mikhail Shufutinsky often sing Rosenbaum's songs.

item.title: Gérard Jaffrès
item.description: Gérard Jaffrès is a French singer, writer and performer.
